Comments_List: I have known more about electrophysiology and clinical cases related to defective ion transporters.

This course went very in depth into the variety of molecular transport motors and their gating. I also learned about the many ways in which failures of transport systems led to human diseases. I found both the first portion of the course, which focused on the mathematical details of transport, and the second portion of the course, which focused on the larger picture, very interesting. The way that the course was structured was also very nice.

Strengths: there are many clinical-related cases which are very interesting. The mathematical part of the course is challenging but interesting to learn. The instructors of the course are very helpful and they are well prepared for the lectures.
I can't think of any glaring weaknesses. A solid course with interesting material.

Yes I will. It is a requirement course for graduate students in the Physiology Department. The instructors are very well-prepared for the lectures. The class size is small and you can interact with others better.
I'd definitely recommend this course to another student! The material is interesting and the workload is very manageable. The instructors were also very helpful.
